data.enText: to allow sb to do sth that you do not agree with or like
data.chText: 容许，允许（不同意或不喜欢的事物）

data.enText: Their relationship was tolerated but not encouraged.
data.chText: 他们的关系得到了允许，但不宜鼓励。

data.enText: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
data.chText: 这种行为是不能容许的。

data.enText: She refused to tolerate being called a liar.
data.chText: 她拒不接受被称为撒谎者。

data.enText: to accept sb/sth that is annoying, unpleasant, etc. without complaining
There is a limit to what one person can tolerate.
data.chText: 一个人的容忍是有限度的。

data.enText: I don't know how you tolerate that noise!
data.chText: 我不知道你怎么能忍受那样的噪音！

data.enText: to be able to be affected by a drug, difficult conditions, etc. without being harmed
data.chText: （对药物）有耐受性；能经受（困难条件）
她对这次化疗的耐受力很强。

data.enText: Few plants will tolerate sudden changes in temperature.
data.chText: 很少植物经受得住气温的突然变化。

means: 容许，允许(不同意或不喜欢的事物)

ex.enText: A strong man will bear hardship without complaining.
ex.chText: 一个坚强的人会忍受困苦而不抱怨。

ex.enText: I cannot bear sleeping in a cold bed.
ex.chText: 睡在冷冰冰的床上我受不了。

ex.enText: She was afraid that her friend wouldn't be able to bear the pain.
ex.chText: 她担心她的朋友忍受不了这种痛苦。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指忍受饥饿、寒冷、疼痛、不幸、困难、侮辱等，多强调忍受者的勇敢和坚毅。

ex.enText: Be quiet! I can't endure the racket any longer.
ex.chText: 请安静点！我再也忍受不了这吵闹声了。

ex.enText: As a Black player, he often has to endure racist taunts.
ex.chText: 作为黑人运动员，他经常得忍受种族歧视性的奚落。

ex.enText: It takes patience to endure hardship.
She longs for a love that can endure all things.
ex.chText: 她渴望一份能经受住一切考验的爱情。

synonyms.bx: 强调长期性，主要指对灾难、困难、疼痛等长时间地忍受而不抱怨。

ex.enText: They stood the test of natural calamity.
ex.chText: 他们经受住了自然灾害的考验。

ex.enText: How can you stand/bear that noise?
ex.chText: 你怎么能忍受那种噪音呢?

ex.enText: I cannot stand/bear to hear such fallacies any more.
ex.chText: 这类谬论我再也听不下去了。

ex.enText: She cannot stand/bear her husband coming home late all the time.
ex.chText: 她不能容忍丈夫老是晚回家。

synonyms.bx: 作“经受”解时，常与 could 或 can 连用，指某人或某物经得起伤害等；作“忍受”解时，主要指对某人、某种困难情况的忍受或承受，通常用于疑问句和否定句中，常可与 bear 换用。

ex.enText: Two soldiers from his squad sustained serious injuries.
ex.chText: 他队中的两名士兵受了重伤。

ex.enText: Several companies have sustained heavy financial losses due to the unfair competition.
ex.chText: 好几家公司都因不正当竞争而遭受了严重的经济损失。

synonyms.bx: 指受到损害、创伤或金钱方面的损失。

ex.enText: Surely, we tolerate all opinions here.
ex.chText: 当然，我们这里容许发表各种意见。
人道主义不能容忍这种罪行。

ex.enText: This is more than she can tolerate.

synonyms.bx: 指以克制的态度容忍令人反感或厌恶的事物，含默认、宽容之意。

tr: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
example: I cannot bear his constant criticism
The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks
he learned to tolerate the heat
She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage

tr: allow the presence of or allow (an activity) without opposing or prohibiting
example: Children are not permitted beyond this point
We cannot tolerate smoking in the hospital

tr: have a tolerance for a poison or strong drug or pathogen or environmental condition
example: The patient does not tolerate the anti-inflammatory drugs we gave him

tr: recognize and respect (rights and beliefs of others)
example: We must tolerate the religions of others

example.ex: She can no longer tolerate the position that she's in...
example.tran: 她再也受不了自己的处境了。

example.ex: The cousins tolerated each other, but did not really get on well together.
example.tran: 这对表亲互相容忍，但是相处得并不真正融洽。

value.def: If you tolerate a situation or person, you accept them although you do not particularly like them.

example.ex: …his views on religious toleration, education, and politics.
example.tran: 他对宗教宽容、教育和政治的看法

example.ex: The ability to tolerate pain varies from person to person.
example.tran: 对疼痛的忍受力因人而异。

value.def: If you can tolerate something unpleasant or painful, you are able to bear it.
